18#include "QRFinderPatternFinder.h"
19#include "QRFinderPatternInfo.h"
20#include "BitMatrix.h"
21#include "ZXContainerAlgorithms.h"

23#include <cassert>
24#include <cmath>
25#include <cstdlib>
26#include <limits>
27#include <algorithm>
28
29namespace ZXing {
30namespace QRCode {
31
32static const int CENTER_QUORUM = 2;
33static const int MIN_SKIP = 3; // 1 pixel/module times 3 modules/center
34static const int MAX_MODULES = 97; // support up to version 20 for mobile clients
35
36using StateCount = std::array<int, 5>;
37
38/**
39* Given a count of black/white/black/white/black pixels just seen and an end position,
40* figures the location of the center of this run.
41*/
42static float CenterFromEnd(const StateCount& stateCount, int end)
43{
44 return end - stateCount[4] - stateCount[3] - stateCount[2] / 2.f;
45}
46
47/**
48* @param stateCount count of black/white/black/white/black pixels just read
49* @param similarityThreshold allow less than "threshold" variance from 1-1-3-1-1 proportions
50* @return true iff the proportions of the counts is close enough to the 1/1/3/1/1 ratios
51* used by finder patterns to be considered a match
52*/
53static bool FoundPattern(const StateCount& stateCount, float similarityThreshold)
54{
55 int totalModuleSize = Reduce(stateCount);
56 if (totalModuleSize < 7) {
57 return false;
58 }
59 float moduleSize = totalModuleSize / 7.0f;
60 float maxVariance = moduleSize * similarityThreshold;
61 return
62 std::abs(moduleSize - stateCount[0]) < maxVariance &&
63 std::abs(moduleSize - stateCount[1]) < maxVariance &&
64 std::abs(3 * moduleSize - stateCount[2]) < 3 * maxVariance &&
65 std::abs(moduleSize - stateCount[3]) < maxVariance &&
66 std::abs(moduleSize - stateCount[4]) < maxVariance;
67}
68
69static bool FoundPatternCross(const StateCount& stateCount)
70{
71 return FoundPattern(stateCount, 0.5f);
72}
73
74static bool FoundPatternDiagonal(const StateCount& stateCount)
75{
76 return FoundPattern(stateCount, 0.75f);
77}
78
79/**
80 * After a vertical and horizontal scan finds a potential finder pattern, this method
81 * "cross-cross-cross-checks" by scanning down diagonally through the center of the possible
82 * finder pattern to see if the same proportion is detected.
83 *
84 * @param centerI row where a finder pattern was detected
85 * @param centerJ center of the section that appears to cross a finder pattern
86 * @param maxCount maximum reasonable number of modules that should be
87 * observed in any reading state, based on the results of the horizontal scan
88 * @param originalStateCountTotal The original state count total.
89 * @return true if proportions are withing expected limits
90 */
91static bool CrossCheckDiagonal(const BitMatrix& image, int centerI, int centerJ)
92{
93 StateCount stateCount = {};
94
95 // Start counting up, left from center finding black center mass
96 int i = 0;
97 while (centerI >= i && centerJ >= i && image.get(centerJ - i, centerI - i)) {
98 stateCount[2]++;
99 i++;
100 }
101 if (stateCount[2] == 0) {
102 return false;
103 }
104
105 // Continue up, left finding white space
106 while (centerI >= i && centerJ >= i && !image.get(centerJ - i, centerI - i)) {
107 stateCount[1]++;
108 i++;
109 }
110 if (stateCount[1] == 0) {
111 return false;
112 }
113
114 // Continue up, left finding black border
115 while (centerI >= i && centerJ >= i && image.get(centerJ - i, centerI - i)) {
116 stateCount[0]++;
117 i++;
118 }
119 if (stateCount[0] == 0) {
120 return false;
121 }
122
123 int maxI = image.height();
124 int maxJ = image.width();
125
126 // Now also count down, right from center
127 i = 1;
128 while (centerI + i < maxI && centerJ + i < maxJ && image.get(centerJ + i, centerI + i)) {
129 stateCount[2]++;
130 i++;
131 }
132
133 while (centerI + i < maxI && centerJ + i < maxJ && !image.get(centerJ + i, centerI + i)) {
134 stateCount[3]++;
135 i++;
136 }
137 if (stateCount[3] == 0) {
138 return false;
139 }
140
141 while (centerI + i < maxI && centerJ + i < maxJ && image.get(centerJ + i, centerI + i)) {
142 stateCount[4]++;
143 i++;
144 }
145 if (stateCount[4] == 0) {
146 return false;
147 }
148
149 return FoundPatternDiagonal(stateCount);
150}
151
152/**
153* <p>After a horizontal scan finds a potential finder pattern, this method
154* "cross-checks" by scanning down vertically through the center of the possible
155* finder pattern to see if the same proportion is detected.</p>
156*
157* @param startI row where a finder pattern was detected
158* @param centerJ center of the section that appears to cross a finder pattern
159* @param maxCount maximum reasonable number of modules that should be
160* observed in any reading state, based on the results of the horizontal scan
161* @return vertical center of finder pattern, or {@link Float#NaN} if not found
162*/
163static float CrossCheckVertical(const BitMatrix& image, int startI, int centerJ, int maxCount, int originalStateCountTotal)
164{
165 StateCount stateCount = {};
166 int maxI = image.height();
167
168 // Start counting up from center
169 int i = startI;
170 while (i >= 0 && image.get(centerJ, i)) {
171 stateCount[2]++;
172 i--;
173 }
174 if (i < 0) {
175 return std::numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN();
176 }
177 while (i >= 0 && !image.get(centerJ, i) && stateCount[1] <= maxCount) {
178 stateCount[1]++;
179 i--;
180 }
181 // If already too many modules in this state or ran off the edge:
182 if (i < 0 || stateCount[1] > maxCount) {
183 return std::numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN();
184 }
185 while (i >= 0 && image.get(centerJ, i) && stateCount[0] <= maxCount) {
186 stateCount[0]++;
187 i--;
188 }
189 if (stateCount[0] > maxCount) {
190 return std::numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN();
191 }
192
193 // Now also count down from center
194 i = startI + 1;
195 while (i < maxI && image.get(centerJ, i)) {
196 stateCount[2]++;
197 i++;
198 }
199 if (i == maxI) {
200 return std::numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN();
201 }
202 while (i < maxI && !image.get(centerJ, i) && stateCount[3] < maxCount) {
203 stateCount[3]++;
204 i++;
205 }
206 if (i == maxI || stateCount[3] >= maxCount) {
207 return std::numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN();
208 }
209 while (i < maxI && image.get(centerJ, i) && stateCount[4] < maxCount) {
210 stateCount[4]++;
211 i++;
212 }
213 if (stateCount[4] >= maxCount) {
214 return std::numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN();
215 }
216
217 // If we found a finder-pattern-like section, but its size is more than 40% different than
218 // the original, assume it's a false positive
219 int stateCountTotal = Reduce(stateCount);
220 if (5 * std::abs(stateCountTotal - originalStateCountTotal) >= 2 * originalStateCountTotal) {
221 return std::numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN();
222 }
223
224 return FoundPatternCross(stateCount) ? CenterFromEnd(stateCount, i) : std::numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN();
225}
226
227/**
228* <p>Like {@link #crossCheckVertical(int, int, int, int)}, and in fact is basically identical,
229* except it reads horizontally instead of vertically. This is used to cross-cross
230* check a vertical cross check and locate the real center of the alignment pattern.</p>
231*/
232static float CrossCheckHorizontal(const BitMatrix& image, int startJ, int centerI, int maxCount, int originalStateCountTotal)
233{
234 StateCount stateCount = {};
235 int maxJ = image.width();
236
237 int j = startJ;
238 while (j >= 0 && image.get(j, centerI)) {
239 stateCount[2]++;
240 j--;
241 }
242 if (j < 0) {
243 return std::numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN();
244 }
245 while (j >= 0 && !image.get(j, centerI) && stateCount[1] <= maxCount) {
246 stateCount[1]++;
247 j--;
248 }
249 if (j < 0 || stateCount[1] > maxCount) {
250 return std::numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN();
251 }
252 while (j >= 0 && image.get(j, centerI) && stateCount[0] <= maxCount) {
253 stateCount[0]++;
254 j--;
255 }
256 if (stateCount[0] > maxCount) {
257 return std::numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN();
258 }
259
260 j = startJ + 1;
261 while (j < maxJ && image.get(j, centerI)) {
262 stateCount[2]++;
263 j++;
264 }
265 if (j == maxJ) {
266 return std::numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN();
267 }
268 while (j < maxJ && !image.get(j, centerI) && stateCount[3] < maxCount) {
269 stateCount[3]++;
270 j++;
271 }
272 if (j == maxJ || stateCount[3] >= maxCount) {
273 return std::numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN();
274 }
275 while (j < maxJ && image.get(j, centerI) && stateCount[4] < maxCount) {
276 stateCount[4]++;
277 j++;
278 }
279 if (stateCount[4] >= maxCount) {
280 return std::numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN();
281 }
282
283 // If we found a finder-pattern-like section, but its size is significantly different than
284 // the original, assume it's a false positive
285 int stateCountTotal = Reduce(stateCount);
286 if (5 * std::abs(stateCountTotal - originalStateCountTotal) >= originalStateCountTotal) {
287 return std::numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN();
288 }
289
290 return FoundPatternCross(stateCount) ? CenterFromEnd(stateCount, j) : std::numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN();
291}
292
293/**
294* @return number of rows we could safely skip during scanning, based on the first
295* two finder patterns that have been located. In some cases their position will
296* allow us to infer that the third pattern must lie below a certain point farther
297* down in the image.
298*/
299static int FindRowSkip(const std::vector<FinderPattern>& possibleCenters, bool& hasSkipped)
300{
301 if (possibleCenters.size() <= 1) {
302 return 0;
303 }
304
305 const ResultPoint* firstConfirmedCenter = nullptr;
306 for (const FinderPattern& center : possibleCenters) {
307 if (center.count() >= CENTER_QUORUM) {
308 if (firstConfirmedCenter == nullptr) {
309 firstConfirmedCenter = &center;
310 }
311 else {
312 // We have two confirmed centers
313 // How far down can we skip before resuming looking for the next
314 // pattern? In the worst case, only the difference between the
315 // difference in the x / y coordinates of the two centers.
316 // This is the case where you find top left last.
317 hasSkipped = true;
318 auto diff = *firstConfirmedCenter - center;
319 return static_cast<int>(std::abs(diff.x) - std::abs(diff.y)) / 2;
320 }
321 }
322 }
323 return 0;
324}
325
326/**
327* <p>This is called when a horizontal scan finds a possible alignment pattern. It will
328* cross check with a vertical scan, and if successful, will, ah, cross-cross-check
329* with another horizontal scan. This is needed primarily to locate the real horizontal
330* center of the pattern in cases of extreme skew.
331* And then we cross-cross-cross check with another diagonal scan.</p>
332*
333* <p>If that succeeds the finder pattern location is added to a list that tracks
334* the number of times each location has been nearly-matched as a finder pattern.
335* Each additional find is more evidence that the location is in fact a finder
336* pattern center
337*
338* @param stateCount reading state module counts from horizontal scan
339* @param i row where finder pattern may be found
340* @param j end of possible finder pattern in row
341* @param possibleCenters [in/out] current list of centers to be updated
342* @return true if a finder pattern candidate was found this time
343*/
344static bool HandlePossibleCenter(const BitMatrix& image, const StateCount& stateCount, int i, int j, std::vector<FinderPattern>& possibleCenters)
345{
346 int stateCountTotal = Reduce(stateCount);
347 float centerJ = CenterFromEnd(stateCount, j);
348 float centerI = CrossCheckVertical(image, i, static_cast<int>(centerJ), stateCount[2], stateCountTotal);
349 if (std::isnan(centerI))
350 return false;
351
352 // Re-cross check
353 centerJ = CrossCheckHorizontal(image, static_cast<int>(centerJ), static_cast<int>(centerI), stateCount[2],
354 stateCountTotal);
355 if (std::isnan(centerJ) || !CrossCheckDiagonal(image, (int)centerI, (int)centerJ))
356 return false;
357
358 float estimatedModuleSize = stateCountTotal / 7.0f;
359 auto center = ZXing::FindIf(possibleCenters, [=](const FinderPattern& center) {
360 return center.aboutEquals(estimatedModuleSize, centerI, centerJ);
361 });
362 if (center != possibleCenters.end())
363 *center = center->combineEstimate(centerI, centerJ, estimatedModuleSize);
364 else
365 possibleCenters.emplace_back(centerJ, centerI, estimatedModuleSize);
366
367 return true;
368}
369
370/**
371* @return true iff we have found at least 3 finder patterns that have been detected
372* at least {@link #CENTER_QUORUM} times each, and, the estimated module size of the
373* candidates is "pretty similar"
374*/
375static bool HaveMultiplyConfirmedCenters(const std::vector<FinderPattern>& possibleCenters)
376{
377 int confirmedCount = 0;
378 float totalModuleSize = 0.0f;
379 for (const FinderPattern& pattern : possibleCenters) {
380 if (pattern.count() >= CENTER_QUORUM) {
381 confirmedCount++;
382 totalModuleSize += pattern.estimatedModuleSize();
383 }
384 }
385 if (confirmedCount < 3) {
386 return false;
387 }
388 // OK, we have at least 3 confirmed centers, but, it's possible that one is a "false positive"
389 // and that we need to keep looking. We detect this by asking if the estimated module sizes
390 // vary too much. We arbitrarily say that when the total deviation from average exceeds
391 // 5% of the total module size estimates, it's too much.
392 float totalDeviation =
393 Reduce(possibleCenters, 0.f, [average = totalModuleSize / possibleCenters.size()](auto sum, auto pattern) {
394 return sum + std::abs(pattern.estimatedModuleSize() - average);
395 });
396
397 return totalDeviation <= 0.05f * totalModuleSize;
398}
399
400/**
401* @return the 3 best {@link FinderPattern}s from our list of candidates. The "best" are
402* those have similar module size and form a shape closer to a isosceles right triangle.
403* Return invalid if 3 such finder patterns do not exist.
404*/
405static FinderPatternInfo SelectBestPatterns(std::vector<FinderPattern> possibleCenters)
406{
407 int nbPossibleCenters = Size(possibleCenters);
408 if (nbPossibleCenters < 3) {
409 // Couldn't find enough finder patterns
410 return {};
411 }
412
413 std::sort(possibleCenters.begin(), possibleCenters.end(), [](const auto& a, const auto& b) {
414 return a.estimatedModuleSize() < b.estimatedModuleSize();
415 });
416
417 double distortion = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
418 std::array<FinderPattern, 3> bestPatterns;
419 std::array<double, 3> squares;
420
421 auto squaredDistance = [](PointF a, PointF b) { return (a - b) * (a - b); };
422
423 for (int i = 0; i < nbPossibleCenters - 2; i++) {
424 auto& fpi = possibleCenters[i];
425 float minModuleSize = fpi.estimatedModuleSize();
426
427 for (int j = i + 1; j < nbPossibleCenters - 1; j++) {
428 auto& fpj = possibleCenters[j];
429 double squares0 = squaredDistance(fpi, fpj);
430
431 for (int k = j + 1; k < nbPossibleCenters; k++) {
432 auto& fpk = possibleCenters[k];
433 float maxModuleSize = fpk.estimatedModuleSize();
434 if (maxModuleSize > minModuleSize * 1.4f) {
435 // module size is not similar. since we sorted the input, we can break the inner loop
436 break;
437 }
438
439 squares[0] = squares0;
440 squares[1] = squaredDistance(fpj, fpk);
441 squares[2] = squaredDistance(fpi, fpk);
442 std::sort(squares.begin(), squares.end());
443
444 // a^2 + b^2 = c^2 (Pythagorean theorem), and a = b (isosceles triangle).
445 // Since any right triangle satisfies the formula c^2 - b^2 - a^2 = 0,
446 // we need to check both two equal sides separately.
447 // The value of |c^2 - 2 * b^2| + |c^2 - 2 * a^2| increases as dissimilarity
448 // from isosceles right triangle.
449 double d = std::abs(squares[2] - 2 * squares[1]) + std::abs(squares[2] - 2 * squares[0]);
450 if (d < distortion) {
451 distortion = d;
452 bestPatterns = {fpi, fpj, fpk};
453 }
454 }
455 }
456 }
457
458 // Orders an array of three Points in an order [A,B,C] such that AB is less than AC
459 // and BC is less than AC, and the angle between BC and BA is less than 180 degrees.
460 // TODO: c++17
461 auto &a = bestPatterns[0], &b = bestPatterns[1], &c = bestPatterns[2];
462
463 if (!a.isValid() && b.isValid() && c.isValid())
464 return {};
465
466 // Find distances between pattern centers
467 float distAB = distance(a, b);
468 float distBC = distance(b, c);
469 float distAC = distance(a, c);
470
471 // Assume one closest to other two is B; A and C will just be guesses at first
472 if (distBC >= distAB && distBC >= distAC)
473 std::swap(a, b);
474 else if (distAC >= distBC && distAC >= distAB)
475 ; // do nothing, the order is correct
476 else
477 std::swap(b, c);
478
479 // Use cross product to figure out whether A and C are correct or flipped.
480 // This asks whether BC x BA has a positive z component, which is the arrangement
481 // we want for A, B, C. If it's negative, then we've got it flipped around and
482 // should swap A and C.
483 if (crossProduct(c - b, a - b) < 0) {
484 std::swap(a, c);
485 }
486
487 return {a, b, c};
488}
489
490FinderPatternInfo FinderPatternFinder::Find(const BitMatrix& image, bool tryHarder)
491{
492 int maxI = image.height();
493 int maxJ = image.width();
494 // We are looking for black/white/black/white/black modules in
495 // 1:1:3:1:1 ratio; this tracks the number of such modules seen so far
496
497 // Let's assume that the maximum version QR Code we support takes up 1/4 the height of the
498 // image, and then account for the center being 3 modules in size. This gives the smallest
499 // number of pixels the center could be, so skip this often. When trying harder, look for all
500 // QR versions regardless of how dense they are.
501 int iSkip = (3 * maxI) / (4 * MAX_MODULES);
502 if (iSkip < MIN_SKIP || tryHarder) {
503 iSkip = MIN_SKIP;
504 }
505
506 bool hasSkipped = false;
507 std::vector<FinderPattern> possibleCenters;
508
509 bool done = false;
510 for (int i = iSkip - 1; i < maxI && !done; i += iSkip) {
511 // Get a row of black/white values
512 StateCount stateCount = {};
513 size_t currentState = 0;
514 for (int j = 0; j < maxJ; j++) {
515 if (image.get(j, i)) {
516 // Black pixel
517 if ((currentState & 1) == 1) { // Counting white pixels
518 currentState++;
519 }
520 stateCount[currentState]++;
521 }
522 else { // White pixel
523 if ((currentState & 1) == 0) { // Counting black pixels
524 if (currentState == 4) { // A winner?
525 if (FoundPatternCross(stateCount)) { // Yes
526 bool confirmed = HandlePossibleCenter(image, stateCount, i, j, possibleCenters);
527 if (confirmed) {
528 // Start examining every other line. Checking each line turned out to be too
529 // expensive and didn't improve performance.
530 iSkip = 2;
531 if (hasSkipped) {
532 done = HaveMultiplyConfirmedCenters(possibleCenters);
533 }
534 else {
535 int rowSkip = FindRowSkip(possibleCenters, hasSkipped);
536 if (rowSkip > stateCount[2]) {
537 // Skip rows between row of lower confirmed center
538 // and top of presumed third confirmed center
539 // but back up a bit to get a full chance of detecting
540 // it, entire width of center of finder pattern
541
542 // Skip by rowSkip, but back off by stateCount[2] (size of last center
543 // of pattern we saw) to be conservative, and also back off by iSkip which
544 // is about to be re-added
545 i += rowSkip - stateCount[2] - iSkip;
546 j = maxJ - 1;
547 }
548 }
549 // Clear state to start looking again
550 currentState = 0;
551 stateCount.fill(0);
552 }
553 else {
554 stateCount[0] = stateCount[2];
555 stateCount[1] = stateCount[3];
556 stateCount[2] = stateCount[4];
557 stateCount[3] = 1;
558 stateCount[4] = 0;
559 currentState = 3;
560 continue;
561 }
562 }
563 else { // No, shift counts back by two
564 stateCount[0] = stateCount[2];
565 stateCount[1] = stateCount[3];
566 stateCount[2] = stateCount[4];
567 stateCount[3] = 1;
568 stateCount[4] = 0;
569 currentState = 3;
570 }
571 }
572 else {
573 stateCount[++currentState]++;
574 }
575 }
576 else { // Counting white pixels
577 stateCount[currentState]++;
578 }
579 }
580 }
581 if (FoundPatternCross(stateCount)) {
582 bool confirmed = HandlePossibleCenter(image, stateCount, i, maxJ, possibleCenters);
583 if (confirmed) {
584 iSkip = stateCount[0];
585 if (hasSkipped) {
586 // Found a third one
587 done = HaveMultiplyConfirmedCenters(possibleCenters);
588 }
589 }
590 }
591 }
592
593 return SelectBestPatterns(possibleCenters);
594}
595
596} // QRCode
597} // ZXing
